data.title: A Shack of A Place with Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: We went there for the authentic Mexican food ... not for the atmosphere. It was really good and genuine but inexpensive Mexican food. The pork was cooked perfectly and the spices were great. It was cheap but tasty. Not fancy.

data.title: Another great time
data.text:
Small and busy, but that's good. Staff is exceptional. Helpful and hardworking to make you service quick.

Food is great with nice size portion. Price is more than reasonable!

data.title: AVERAGE
data.text:
It is, perhaps, unfair to compose a review, in which you compare one restaurant to another.  What does the food and quality of one restaurant have to do with another?  But, in this case, given that the competing restaurant (Señor Taco) is nearby and the same kind of place, I think it's justified making the comparison this time.

I decided one happy day after the gym, that I'd had enough of Señor Taco over and over again and remembered that I had been at Don Pancho's once before and couldn't recall anything negative about it.  So, I figured I'd give it another try.  While not located in the best part of Avondale, it's pretty safe going there during the day.  The inside is decently spacious and the staff is certainly friendly enough; but it didn't take me long to have issues.  First, it was 112F out that day ... and maybe close to mid-80s or more inside.  Yes, they have a/c; but they rely more on the ceiling fans, which, while keeping the place pleasantly cool-ish enough, is hardly comfortable.  I can only imagine what the poor people in the kitchen were going through.  Decor in the place is nice (especially the tilework and art) and the place has an airy and open feel about it (though there are only, maybe, 8 tables or so).

Complaint Number One was the fountain drinks, which, at $2.25 for a large, is far from cheap, but refills from a fountain cost another 99 cents?!?  Truly, I realize restaurants have to make money, too; but the syrup for a soda fountain is hardly a big expenditure and when you consider most restaurants offer free refills, this comes across as a bit tacky.

I ordered two helpings of ceviche (with tostada) and rather than separate the orders, they put them together in one box.  I admit, I didn't ask them to separate them; but before assuming the second person having it was dining with me, it would've been nice to ask whether I wanted them in the same box (to be fair, Señor Taco has done that, too; and I now ask them to put them in separate boxes whenever I order two ceviches).  The ceviche tasted good, but, unlike our good friend Señor Taco, they don't servie it with any kind of sauce; put one tiny lime wedge in it; and the tostadas are about the size of a DVD disk (i.e., two tostadas for two orders don't cut it).  Quantity was decent, but the fish and veggies are cut up very small and "seem" to have less volume than the ceviche at ... you know where.

Next, there was the fish burrito.  Señor Taco's fish burrito has a little lettuce, some rice and, I suspect, lots of mayo.  The one here had a lot of shredded lettuce, loose, short-grain rice and no sauce I could detect.  It was good, but, of course, it's the fat that gives flavor.  Also, smaller portion than at Señor Taco's on Estrella Parkway, but more expensive.  So ...

FISH BURRITO

Don Pancho:  lots of shredded lettuce; very loose, short-grain rice; not much fish; fat burrito but not very long

Señor Taco:  not much lettuce; compact, long-grain rice held together by sauce; large pieces of fish; fat and long burrito

The shrimp burrito a la diabla was also good, but I couldn't identify the sauce (and there wasn't much of it), there was much more rice and beans, a taste that, while somewhat spicy, was not what I'd call hot.  So ...

SHRIMP BURRITO A LA DIABLA

Don Pancho:  mild and unidentifiable sauce; not much shrimp; lots of rice and beans; fat, but short, burrito

Señor Taco:  very spicy and hot sauce; possibly some mayo or other cream sauce; lots of shrimp, fat and long

So far, Señor Taco was beating this place hands down.  I did like that Don Pancho had fresh cucumbers at the salsa stand, though, again, the salsa stand at Señor Taco's is more extensive.

So, to sum up:

Ceviche - much better at Señor Taco and only a little more expensive;
Burritos - much better at Señor Taco and cheaper (or the same);
Soda - cheaper at Señor Taco and free refills (or, if not, they never stopped anyone refilling);
Cleanliness - probably the same, but Don Pancho's looks nicer;
Comfort - No comparison.  Señor Taco is a walk-in fridge compared to this place;
Cost - Bigger portions and tastier at Señor Taco for about the same price or a little less (could be more than a little less if you buy one of their specials).

Would I steer people away from Don Pancho?  No.  The food is good and the people there are really nice.  But having been way too many times to Señor Taco, I'm definitely biased.  You'll have to decide whether that bias is justified ... but I think it is.

data.title: Wow
data.text:
Food was excellent, quick, hot and delicious. Place is in a strip mall, but we have found that these little places often have the best food. Order at the counter, food is served quickly. Room is not very large,but was very clean, we ate about 2pm on Monday and it wasn't too crowded.
We had the chimichanga and it was good sized, and I ate it all! so tasty! Beans were above the standard, more like a bean soup, delicious, rice was good also.
We will be back!

data.title: Outstanding lunch!!
data.text: Stopped in while I was in the area after seeing their business. Quaint place with a warm feeling and a great Frida Kahlo print on the wall. Great lunch specials with larger than normal portions!! Clean warm atmosphere with a happy group of folks running the place. Stop in and enjoy an awesome, filling number off of the menu of many choices. Everything hit the spot and it was nice to be appreciated for my business! Go check them out...what are you waiting for?!?!

data.title: Excellent Little Mom and Pop Mexican Place
data.text: This is a great little place hidden away in a strip mall.  It is small and was busy.  I ordered the Mini Chimichanga plate which came with rice and beans. They served nachos before the food came out. I was very surprised that the nachos were covered with beans and cheese.  I have never seen this served as a free item before.  It tasted great. The mini chimi plate came with four chimichangas which tasted excellent. The rice and beans were also very good. The service was very fast even with the place being full. The total cost was under ten dollars with a drink. This hidden little place is definitely worth looking for.

data.title: Small but mighty.
data.text: We have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed.  The staff are friendly and food tastes authentic.  The fans are needed as their air conditioning isn't very cool, but the food makes it worth while!

data.title: Nothing fancy just good food
data.text:
Looking for decent Mexican restaurant while staying nearby and found Don Pancho. Restaurant is fairly basic and don't serve alcohol.
To offset that, their food is fantastic. 
Opted for their combination platter that included Carne Asada tacos, beans and rice.
All very tasty and the beans had a smooth and very flavorful texture.
Salsa bar included the basics and all were tasty.
Highly recommend. 
Ended up with two combos that included 10 tacos and total bill was <$35. Great bargain.

data.title: Excellent food for price and quality
data.text: Was craving Mexican when I was visiting.  Found this place by yelping it.  Next time visiting Phoenix, I will most likely visit this place gain.  Not only is this place, the cheapest Mexican food I've had, it's also the friendliest, and one of the best customer service we received while visiting Phoenix.  The salsa bar is fresh and very tasteful.  You can tell that place is well liked.  The majority of customers are regular locals.

data.title: Truly authentic
data.text: My wife and I from the east were in the area to take a balloon ride.  We didn't go on Friday but did go on Sunday.  See a separate review for Equinox Balloons.  We found Don Pancho on line.  What a treat!!!!  If the restaurant served anything more authentic, we'd be in somebody's home.  The food was simply OUTSTANDING.  Though the restaurant lacks in ambiance, the food, the reason one goes, was just out of this world.  The service was nice and our waiter, Marcos, incredibly friendly.  Their home made corn torillas are lip-smacking, especially when filled with whatever you get!

data.title: Mexican food must
data.text: Any time we are in the area we go to Don Panchos. This is quality authentic Mexican food at a fair price. Also the salsa bar is convenient. Service is always friendly. Highly recommended.

data.title: Yummy Lunch
data.text: This is the most authentic Mexican we have been to in the West Valley. The lunch menu was awesome, affordable and yummy. The chimis were amazing.   The staff went out of their way to explain everything on the menu. Food is fresh and delicious. It's not a big dining area but this shouldn't take away from the rating if the food. We brought home fish tacos for my dad and he LOVED them.

data.title: Good food small dinning room
data.text: Food was good and had the home style flavor to it. Our only issue was dinning area s small and not set up for a family sit down. Ok if it is 2-3 people. Other than that order take out and enjoy at home

data.title: Can't be beat for authentic Mexican
data.text: The best in authentic Mexican food, we eat here to celebrate special occasions.  They make us feel like we are being served in their home, the service is that good.  The best bang for your buck, prices are excellent for the amount of food you get.

data.title: After church with friends, and we found a new favorite Mexican Food Restaurant!!!
data.text: Looking for a new Mexican Food Restaurant, we found this wonderful place after our Saturday night church service at Palm Valley Church with some of our favorite people!   I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised!!!  The service was very friendly, and the food was great!!  My favorite dish is Chile Relleno, and I wasn't disappointed here!  The combo dinner includes some of the best refried beans I've eaten in a very long time, and the Relleno was perfect and prepared with a FRESH green chile, not canned or frozen!  The salsa bar had some great green and red sauces, and believe me, I tried them all!!  Obviously fresh home made!!!  I got corn tortillas with my meal that were also fresh home made and absolutely scrumptious!!!!!  My wife couldn't finish her Green Chile Burrito, but managed to clean up her beans!!!  (which she never does!!!  They were that good!!!)  The chips and salsa were excellent, smeared with a bit of refried beans and white Mexican cheese crumbles!!  Oh yes, that same cheese was crumbled over the beans as well!!!  We've found a new favorite place!!!!!

data.title: Lunch with my husband...
data.text: The restaurant was clean. You order at the counter. It is AUTHENTIC mexican food. It is not what we are used to when we have had mexican on the east coast...this is more like real authentic mexican food. The locals seem to love it. What we had was edible bit it is not what we prefer and that is why i rated it a 3. Not my cup of tea.

data.title: It ain't swanky, but it's good authentic Mexican Food.
data.text:
My neighbor recommended the Diablo Shrimp, and he was right. Perfectly cooked shrimp in a zingy sauce severed with light rice and beans. Since then, I've been back . . . a lot, and I've tried several of their other dishes. All of their food is prepared fresh, and you can taste that. Last time I tried their Posole. Unlike the chain restaurants in town, it wasn't loaded with sault so I could enjoy the subtle flavors of mix of ingredients along with large chunks of tender pork.

I'm going back again when I get a hankern' for another bowl . . . I hope there's a chair to sit at when I get there.

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
Paula and I came here for dinner based on a TripAdvisor recommendation. I will say that I'm starting to believe that some of the best Mexican food I have been tasting is from restaurants in strip malls. This is one of those places you know is going to be good because all the locals are eating here. It's a walk-up and order-off-the-menu-board kind of place, but if this is your first time visiting, they are more than willing to explain the menu and make recommendations. 

Paula and I both ordered the #12 combination dinner. They offer quite a few fillings from beef tongue to tripe. I had the tripe, beef, and pork. They were all tender and tasted excellent. Before our dinners arrived, we received some chips and salsa. The chips had beans and cheese on them, but the real winner was the salsa. It had a wonderful kick. Not so overpowering or bland that you didn't want to eat anymore. The dinner also came with a roasted jalapeño pepper (which was excellently cooked), beans, rice, and a large beverage with free refills. They also have several homemade deserts if you still have room after finishing your meal. 

All in all, I would say that this meal was one of the best meals I have had on this trip. I would highly recommend that you try it for yourself and don't worry at all about it being located in a strip mall.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: We came here because our other Mexican joint let us down and we are soooooo happy we came!! Very kid friendly, salsa is amazing and staff is awesome.. we will be back!!..

data.title: I'd take my madre here
data.text: Lot's of tasty food here but the chips n salsa with beans are a really good touch while waiting on your food
